A **baby crocodile**, :, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. The baby crocodile is a [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal") that is part of the [lizard](/wiki/Lizard_\(monster_class\) "Lizard (monster class)") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class"). Baby crocodiles are [amphibious](/wiki/Amphibious "Amphibious") and capable of [swimming](/wiki/Swimming "Swimming").

A baby crocodile has a bite attack.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [4.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [4.5 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [4.6 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Randomly-generated baby crocodiles are always created hostile. A baby crocodile can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into a [crocodile](/wiki/Crocodile "Crocodile"), and [eggs](/wiki/Egg "Egg") laid by crocodiles will hatch into baby crocodiles.

## Strategy

Baby crocodiles are very slow-moving, and their bite is not too threatening for most characters unless they have poor [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") or else are low on health. Escaping from a baby crocodile is trivial, outside of severe [encumbrance](/wiki/Encumbrance "Encumbrance") or poor luck with monster generation (e.g. a [wand of create monster](/wiki/Wand_of_create_monster "Wand of create monster") or [scroll of create monster](/wiki/Scroll_of_create_monster "Scroll of create monster") surrounds a character with hostiles).

## History

The baby crocodile first appears in [NetHack 3.0.7](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.7 "NetHack 3.0.7").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [quaffing](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff") from a [toilet](/wiki/Toilet "Toilet") has an effective 2⁄45 chance of generating a baby if done in the form of a [canine](/wiki/Canine "Canine"), and a 2⁄9 chance of generating one otherwise, unless baby crocodiles are [extinct](/wiki/Extinct "Extinct") or [genocided](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide") in either case.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Breaking a toilet by [kicking](/wiki/Kick "Kick") it has a 1⁄3 chance of generating 2-6 baby crocodiles.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), the [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist") role's default pet is a baby crocodile.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), baby crocodiles may be generated as [minions](/wiki/Minion "Minion") of [Offler](/wiki/Offler "Offler").

[Drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\) "Drow (starting race)") characters can tame baby crocodiles and ride them as steeds.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), two baby crocodiles are generated in the Sewers of Waterdeep map of [Mines' End](/wiki/Mines%27_End "Mines' End") at level creation.

All growth stages of crocodile move much faster when underwater than they do on land.

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), in addition to SLASH'EM details, the [Corsair](/wiki/Corsair "Corsair") has a 1⁄5 chance of starting with a baby crocodile named Snappy as their default pet.

### Hack'EM

[Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") has the same odds of generating baby crocodiles from a toilet as in SLASH'EM, and generates two baby crocodiles in the Sewers of Waterdeep map for [Mines' End](/wiki/Mines%27_End "Mines' End") at level creation, as in EvilHack.

## Encyclopedia entry

- *See the [encyclopedia entry for crocodile](/wiki/Crocodile#Encyclopedia_entry "Crocodile").*

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [fountain.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 701](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/fountain.c#line701 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/fountain.c")
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [fountain.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 553](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/fountain.c#line553 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/fountain.c")

Baby crocodile

: baby crocodile

: baby crocodile
Difficulty 4
Attacks

Bite 1d4

Base level 3
Base experience 28
Speed 6
Base AC 7
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 200
Nutritional value 200
Size Medium
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A baby crocodile:

  • can swim.
  • can survive underwater.
  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
Reference monst.c#line2868

A baby crocodile, :, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. The baby crocodile is a carnivorous animal that is part of the lizard monster class. Baby crocodiles are amphibious and capable of swimming.

A baby crocodile has a bite attack.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 SLASH'EM
    • 4.2 UnNetHack
    • 4.3 dNetHack
    • 4.4 EvilHack
    • 4.5 SlashTHEM
    • 4.6 Hack'EM
  • 5 Encyclopedia entry
  • 6 References

Generation

Randomly-generated baby crocodiles are always created hostile. A baby crocodile can grow up into a crocodile, and eggs laid by crocodiles will hatch into baby crocodiles.

Strategy

Baby crocodiles are very slow-moving, and their bite is not too threatening for most characters unless they have poor AC or else are low on health. Escaping from a baby crocodile is trivial, outside of severe encumbrance or poor luck with monster generation (e.g. a wand of create monster or scroll of create monster surrounds a character with hostiles).

History

The baby crocodile first appears in NetHack 3.0.7.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, quaffing from a toilet has an effective 2⁄45 chance of generating a baby if done in the form of a canine, and a 2⁄9 chance of generating one otherwise, unless baby crocodiles are extinct or genocided in either case.[1] Breaking a toilet by kicking it has a 1⁄3 chance of generating 2-6 baby crocodiles.[2]

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, the Tourist role's default pet is a baby crocodile.

dNetHack

In dNetHack and notdNetHack, baby crocodiles may be generated as minions of Offler.

Drow characters can tame baby crocodiles and ride them as steeds.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, two baby crocodiles are generated in the Sewers of Waterdeep map of Mines' End at level creation.

All growth stages of crocodile move much faster when underwater than they do on land.

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, in addition to SLASH'EM details, the Corsair has a 1⁄5 chance of starting with a baby crocodile named Snappy as their default pet.

Hack'EM

Hack'EM has the same odds of generating baby crocodiles from a toilet as in SLASH'EM, and generates two baby crocodiles in the Sewers of Waterdeep map for Mines' End at level creation, as in EvilHack.

Encyclopedia entry

See the encyclopedia entry for crocodile.

References

  1. ↑ fountain.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 701
  2. ↑ fountain.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 553

A '''baby crocodile''', {{monsym|baby crocodile}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. The baby crocodile is a [[carnivorous]] [[animal]] that is part of the [[Lizard (monster class)|lizard]] [[monster class]]. Baby crocodiles are [[amphibious]] and capable of [[swimming]].

A baby crocodile has a bite attack.

==Generation==
Randomly-generated baby crocodiles are always created hostile. A baby crocodile can [[grow up]] into a [[crocodile]], and [[egg]]s laid by crocodiles will hatch into baby crocodiles.

==Strategy==
Baby crocodiles are very slow-moving, and their bite is not too threatening for most characters unless they have poor [[AC]] or else are low on health. Escaping from a baby crocodile is trivial, outside of severe [[encumbrance]] or poor luck with monster generation (e.g. a [[wand of create monster]] or [[scroll of create monster]] surrounds a character with hostiles).

==History==
The baby crocodile first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.7]].

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], [[quaff]]ing from a [[toilet]] has an effective {{frac|2|45}} chance of generating a baby if done in the form of a [[canine]], and a {{frac|2|9}} chance of generating one otherwise, unless baby crocodiles are [[extinct]] or [[genocide]]d in either case.{{refsrc|fountain.c|701|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}} Breaking a toilet by [[kick]]ing it has a {{frac|3}} chance of generating 2-6 baby crocodiles.{{refsrc|fountain.c|553|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2}} 

===UnNetHack===
In [[UnNetHack]], the [[Tourist]] role's default pet is a baby crocodile.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]], baby crocodiles may be generated as [[minion]]s of [[Offler]].

[[Drow (starting race)|Drow]] characters can tame baby crocodiles and ride them as steeds.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], two baby crocodiles are generated in the Sewers of Waterdeep map of [[Mines' End]] at level creation.

All growth stages of crocodile move much faster when underwater than they do on land.

===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], in addition to SLASH'EM details, the [[Corsair]] has a {{frac|5}} chance of starting with a baby crocodile named Snappy as their default pet.

===Hack'EM===
[[Hack'EM]] has the same odds of generating baby crocodiles from a toilet as in SLASH'EM, and generates two baby crocodiles in the Sewers of Waterdeep map for [[Mines' End]] at level creation, as in EvilHack.
